meanings.definition: To lift or hoist with effort.
meanings.sent1: She struggled to heeze the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The workers heeze the flag up the pole every morning.
meanings.sent3: With a mighty heeze, the little girl tried to lift the giant pumpkin.
meanings.sent4: The crane heezed the container effortlessly into the air.
meanings.sent5: Heeze the rope slowly to avoid dropping the load.

meanings.sent1: Her words heezed him to keep going despite the challenges.
meanings.sent2: The coach heezed the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent3: The motivational speaker heezed the audience to chase their dreams.
meanings.sent4: The success stories heezed her to pursue her own goals.
meanings.sent5: Heeze yourself to take the first step towards your dreams.

meanings.sent1: The heeze of the crowd filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent2: A sudden heeze echoed through the silent night.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected heeze startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: His heeze of joy could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent5: The heeze of the whistle signaled the start of the race.
